00001 ################################################################################
00002 # navicom.py

00007 from curie.navicell import *
00008 from .navidata import *

00011 DEBUG_NAVICOM = True
00012 VERBOSE_NAVICOM = True
00013 
00014 def getLine(ll, split_char="\t"):
00015     ll = re.sub('\"', '', ll.strip())
00016     ll = re.sub('\tNA', '\tNaN', ll) # Python float can convert "NaN" -> nan but not "NA" -> nan
00017     ll = ll.split(split_char)
00018     for ii in range(len(ll)):
00019         try:
00020             ll[ii] = float(ll[ii])
00021         except:
00022             pass
00023     return(ll)
00024 
00025 class NaviCom():
00026     """
00027     NaviComm class to handle data and display them in a standardized way on NaviCell maps
00028     """
00029 
00030     def __init__(self, map_url='https://navicell.curie.fr/navicell/maps/cellcycle/master/index.php', fname="", modules_dict="", browser_command="firefox %s", display_config=DisplayConfig()):
00031         """
00032         Initialize a Navicell communication object.
00033         Args:
00034             map_url (str): URL of the NaviCell map
00035             fname (str): name of the data file to load
00036             modules_dict (str): name of the module definition file (.gmt) to load
00037             browser_command (str): command to open the browser
00038         """
00039         # Build options for the navicell connexion
00040         options = Options()
00041         options.map_url = map_url
00042         idx = options.map_url.find('/navicell/')
00043         options.proxy_url = options.map_url[0:idx] + '/cgi-bin/nv_proxy.php'
00044         options.browser_command = browser_command # TODO Add user control
00045         self._nv = NaviCell(options)
00046         ## Name of the dataset
00047         self.name = "no_name" 
00048         # NaviCell export control
00049         self._exported_annotations = False
00050         self._browser_opened = False
00051         self._biotypes = dict()
00052         # Representation of the data
00053         self._display_config = display_config
00054         # Data, indexed by processing then type of data
00055         self._processings = PROCESSINGS
00056         self._data = dict() # All data
00057         self._exported_data = dict() # Whether data have been exported yet
00058         self._data_names = dict() # Name of the exported data
00059         self._associated_data = dict() # Processing and method associated to each name
00060         for processing in self._processings:
00061             self._data[processing] = dict()
00062             self._exported_data[processing] = dict()
00063             self._data_names[processing] = dict()
00064         self._exported_data["uniform"] = False
00065         ## Annotations of the samples
00066         self.annotations = dict()
00067         ## Composition of the modules
00068         self.modules = dict()
00069         self._associated_modules = dict() # Number of modules each gene belong to
00070         if (fname != ""):
00071             self.loadData(fname)
00072             self.defineModules(modules_dict)
00073         # Remember how many samples and datatables were selected in NaviCell in the heatmap and barplot editors
00074         self._hsid = 0
00075         self._hdid = 0
00076         self._bid = 0
00077 
00078     def listData(self):
00079         print("Data available :")
00080         for processing in self._processings:
00081             for dname in self._data[processing]:
00082                 if (dname.lower() in METHODS_TYPE):
00083                     print("\t" + processing + " " + dname + ": " + METHODS_TYPE[dname.lower()] + " (biotype: " + TYPES_BIOTYPE[METHODS_TYPE[dname.lower()]] + ")")
00084                 else:
00085                     print("\t" + processing + " " + dname)
00086 
00087     def listAnnotations(self):
00088         print("Annotations available (values) :")
00089         for annot in self.annotations.annotations:
00090             print("\t" + annot + " : " + str(set(self.annotations[annot])))
00091 
00092     def __repr__(self):
00093         rpr = "NaviCom object with " + str(len(self._data)) + " types of data:\n"
00094         for method in self._data:
00095             rpr += method + ": " + self._data[method] + "\n"
00096         rpr += "and " + str(len(self.moduleAverage)) + " modules average:\n"
00097         for method in self.moduleAverage:
00098             rpr += method + ": " + self.moduleAverage[method] + "\n"
00099         return(repr)
00100     
00101     def _nameData(self, method, processing="raw", name=""):
00102         if (name == ""):
00103             name = method + "_" + processing
00104         self._data_names[processing][method] = name
00105         self._associated_data[name] = (processing, method)
00106         return (name)
00107 
00108     def getDataName(self, data_name):
00109         """
00110         Return the string identifier corresponding to the data name or tuple
00111 
00112         Args:
00113             data_name (str or tuple): Identifier of the data
00114         """
00115         dTuple = self.getDataTuple(data_name)
00116         return(self._data_names[dTuple[0]][dTuple[1]])
00117 
00118     def getDataTuple(self, data_name):
00119         """
00120         Return tuple corresponding to the data name or tuple
00121         """
00122         if (isinstance(data_name, str)):
00123             if (data_name in self._associated_data):
00124                 return(self._associated_data[data_name])
00125             elif (data_name + "_raw" in self._associated_data):
00126                 return(self._associated_data[data_name + "_raw"])
00127         elif (isinstance(data_name, tuple) and len(data_name) == 2):
00128             if (data_name[0] in self._processings):
00129                 return(data_name)
00130             elif (data_name[1] in self._processings):
00131                 return((data_name[1],data_name[0]))
00132         raise ValueError("Invalid name or tuple for data: " + str(data_name))
00133 
00134     def getData(self, data_name):
00135         """
00136         Return the NaviData entity corresponding to the data name or tuple
00137 
00138         Args:
00139             data_name (str or tuple): Identifier of the data
00140         """
00141         dTuple = self.getDataTuple(data_name)
00142         return(self._data[dTuple[0]][dTuple[1]])
00143 
00144     # Load new data
00145     def loadData(self, fname="data/Ovarian_Serous_Cystadenocarcinoma_TCGA_Nature_2011.txt", keep_mutations_nan=False):
00146         """
00147         Load data from a .txt or .ncc file containing several datas, or from a .tsv, .ncd or .nca file containing data from one method.
00148 
00149         Args:
00150             fname (str): name of the file from which the data should be loaded
00151             keep_mutations_nan(str): whether nan in mutations data should be considered as no mutation (False) or missing value (True)
00152         """
00153         with open(fname) as file_conn:
00154             ff = file_conn.readlines()
00155             ll = 0
00156         # Name the dataset according to the filename, and issue a warning if the name changes
00157         dname = parseFilename(fname)[0]
00158         if (dname != self.name and self.name != "no_name"):
00159             warn("Name of the dataset " + self.name + " has been changed to " + dname)
00160         self.name = dname
00161 
00162         dataRegex = "^M |^GENE"
00163         annotRegex = "^ANNOTATIONS|^NAME"
00164         completeRegex = dataRegex + "|" + annotRegex
00165         methodFromFile = False
00166         while (ll < len(ff)):
00167             if (re.search(dataRegex, ff[ll])):
00168                 # Import data
00169                 # Use the method and processing names if they are provided, otherwise deduce them from the filename 
00170                 if (re.search("^M ", ff[ll])):
00171                     line = re.sub("^M", "", ff[ll].strip()).split("\t")
00172                     method = line[0].strip()
00173                     if (len(line) > 1 and line[1] in self._processings):
00174                         processing = line[1].strip()
00175                     else:
00176                         processing = "raw"
00177                     samples = getLine(ff[ll+1])
00178                     if (samples[0] == "GENE"):
00179                         samples = samples[1:]
00180                     ll += 2
00181                 elif (re.search("^GENE", ff[ll])):
00182                     fname = os.path.split(fname)[1]
00183                     dname, processing, method = parseFilename(fname)
00184                     # Deduction cannot be performed
00185                     if (methodFromFile):
00186                         raise ValueError("A type of data must be provided when importing several data in one file")
00187                     else:
00188                         methodFromFile = True
00189                     samples = getLine(ff[ll])[1:]
00190                     ll += 1
00191                 print("Importing " + method + " data")
00192                 profile_data = dict()
00193                 profile_data["samples"] = oDict()
00194                 profile_data["genes"] = dict()
00195                 profile_data["data"] = list()
00196                 ii = 0
00197                 for el in samples:
00198                     profile_data["samples"][el] = ii
00199                     ii += 1
00200 
00201                 gid = 0
00202                 while(ll < len(ff) and not re.search(completeRegex, ff[ll])):
00203                     dl = getLine(ff[ll])
00204                     profile_data["data"].append(dl[1:]) # Data in a list at index gene_name
00205                     profile_data["genes"][dl[0]] = gid
00206                     gid += 1
00207 
00208                     ll += 1
00209                 if (processing in self._data and method in self._data[processing]):
00210                     warn("Overwriting data for method " + method + " with processing " + processing)
00211                 self._data[processing][method] = NaviData(profile_data["data"], profile_data["genes"], profile_data["samples"], processing, method)
00212                 self._exported_data[processing][method] = False
00213                 self.quantifyMutations(method)
00214                 self._nameData(method, processing)
00215                 if (not "uniform" in self._data):
00216                     self._defineUniformData(profile_data["samples"], profile_data["genes"])
00217             elif (re.search(annotRegex, ff[ll])):
00218                 # Import annotations
00219                 print("Importing Annotations")
00220                 if (re.search("^ANNOTATIONS", ff[ll])):
00221                     annotations_names = getLine(ff[ll+1])
00222                     if (annotations_names[0] == "NAME"):
00223                         annotations_names = annotations_names[1:]
00224                     ll += 2
00225                 elif (re.search("^NAME", ff[ll])):
00226                     annotations_names = getLine(ff[ll][1:])
00227                     ll += 1
00228                 annot = dict()
00229                 annot["names"] = list()
00230                 annot["samples"] = list()
00231                 annot["annot"] = list()
00232                 not_all = not "all" in annotations_names
00233                 if (not_all):
00234                     annot["names"].append("all")
00235                     annot["annot"].append([1 for ii in range(nb_samples)])
00236                 for name in annotations_names:
00237                     annot["names"].append(name)
00238                 while(ll < len(ff) and not re.search(completeRegex, ff[ll])):
00239                     al = getLine(ff[ll])
00240                     # Gather each annotation for this sample and add all as the first column if necessary
00241                     if (not_all):
00242                         annot["annot"].append([1] + al[1:])
00243                     else:
00244                         annot["annot"].append(al[1:])
00245                     annot["samples"].append(al[0])
00246 
00247                     ll = ll+1
00248                 self.annotations = NaviAnnotations(annot["annot"], annot["samples"], annot["names"], dType="annotations")
00249             else:
00250                 raise ValueError("Incorrect format, file must be a valid file for NaviCell or an aggregation of such files with headers to indicate the type of data")
00251 
00252     def bindNaviData(self, navidata, method, processing):
00253         """
00254         Bind a NaviData datatable to the NaviCom object in order to use it 
00255 
00256         Args:
00257             navidata (NaviData): the NaviData datatable to bind
00258             method (str): the method used to get the data
00259             processing (str): the visualisation related processing applied to the data
00260         """
00261         assert isinstance(navidata, NaviData), "navidata is not a NaviData object"
00262         self._newProcessedData(processing, method, navidata)
00263 
00264     def _defineUniformData(self, samples, genes):
00265         self._data["uniform"] = NaviData( np.array([[1] * len(samples) for nn in genes]), genes, samples )
00266         # TODO change to 1.0 when < is changed to <= for continuous data
00267 
00268     def _newProcessedData(self, processing, method, data):
00269         """
00270         Update adequate arrays when processed data are generated
00271         """
00272         assert processing in self._processings, "Processing " + processing + " is not handled"
00273         self._data[processing][method] = data
00274         self._exported_data[processing][method] = False
00275         self._nameData(method, processing)
00276 
00277     # Process data
00278     def quantifyMutations(self, method, keep_nan=False):
00279         """
00280         Transform the qualitative mutation datas into a quantitative one, where 1 means a mutation and 0 no mutation.
00281         Args:
00282             keep_nan : Should nan values be converted to O (no mutations) or kept as missing data
00283         """
00284         if (method in self._data["raw"] and METHODS_TYPE[method.lower()] == "mutations"):
00285             mutations = NaviData(np.zeros(self._data["raw"][method].data.shape), self._data["raw"][method].rows_names, self._data["raw"][method].columns_names, method)
00286             for rr in range(len(self._data["raw"][method].rows_names)):
00287                 for cc in range(len(self._data["raw"][method].columns_names)):
00288                     value = self._data["raw"][method][rr][cc]
00289                     if ( re.match("nan|na", value.lower()) ):
00290                         if (keep_nan):
00291                             mutations.data[rr][cc] = np.nan
00292                         else:
00293                             mutations.data[rr][cc] = 0
00294                     elif ( value == "" ):
00295                         mutations.data[rr][cc] = 0
00296                     else:
00297                         mutations.data[rr][cc] = 1
00298             self._newProcessedData("mutationQuantification", method, mutations)
00299 
00300     def defineModules(self, modules_dict=""):
00301         """
00302         Defines the modules to use and which module each gene belongs to.
00303 
00304         Args:
00305             modules_dict : Either a dict indexed by module name or a file name with the description of each module (.gmt file: tab delimited, first column module name, second column description, then list of entities in the module)
00306         """
00307         # Gather the composition of each module
00308         self.modules = dict()
00309         if (isinstance(modules_dict, dict)):
00310             self.modules = modules_dict 
00311         elif (isinstance(modules_dict, str)):
00312             if (modules_dict != ""):
00313                 with open(modules_dict) as ff:
00314                     for line in ff.readlines():
00315                         ll = line.strip().split("\t")
00316                         module_name = ll[0]
00317                         self.modules[module_name] = ll[2:]
00318 
00319         # TODO add control that the genes in the modules have data
00320         """
00321         # Only keep genes with data
00322         for module in self.modules:
00323             keep = list()
00324             for gene in self.modules[module]:
00325                 if (not gene in self.genes_list):
00326                     self.modules[module].remove(gene)
00327         """
00328         # Count the number of modules each gene belong to
00329         self._associated_modules = dict()
00330         for module_name in self.modules.keys():
00331             for gene in self.modules[module_name]:
00332                 try:
00333                     self._associated_modules[gene].append(module_name)
00334                 except KeyError:
00335                     self._associated_modules[gene] = [module_name]
00336 
00337     def averageModule(self, method):
00338         """
00339         Perform module averaging for every modules for one data type
00340         """
00341         assert method in self._data["raw"], "This type of data is not present"
00342         assert len(self.modules)>0, "No module have been defined"
00343 
00344         # Calculate average expression for each module
00345         data = self._data["raw"][method]
00346         samples = list(data.samples.keys())
00347         module_expression = dict()
00348         for module in self.modules:
00349             module_expression[module] = [0 for sample in samples]
00350             non_nan = np.array([0 for sample in samples])
00351             no_data = list()
00352             for gene in self.modules[module]:
00353                 try:
00354                     not_nan = np.array([int(not np.isnan(dd)) for dd in data[gene].data])
00355                     non_nan += not_nan
00356                     non_nan_data = data[gene].data * not_nan
00357                     non_nan_data[np.isnan(non_nan_data)] = 0
00358                     module_expression[module] += non_nan_data
00359                 except IndexError:
00360                     no_data += [gene]
00361             for gene in no_data:
00362                 #self.modules[module].remove(gene)
00363                 if (VERBOSE_NAVICOM):
00364                     print(gene + " from module " + module + " has no " + method + " data")
00365             module_expression[module] /= non_nan
00366 
00367         # Calculate average module expression for each gene
00368         gene_module_average = list()
00369         for gene in data.genes:
00370             if gene in self._associated_modules:
00371                 gene_module_average.append(np.array([0. for sample in data.samples]))
00372                 for module in self._associated_modules[gene]:
00373                     gene_module_average[-1] += module_expression[module] / len(self._associated_modules[gene])
00374             else:
00375                 gene_module_average.append(np.array(list(data[gene])))
00376                 print(gene)
00377 
00378         # Put the averaging in a NaviData structure
00379         #self._data["moduleAverage"][method] = NaviData(list(module_expression.values()), list(self.modules.keys()), samples) # Usefull if NaviCell allow modules values one day
00380         self._newProcessedData("moduleAverage", method, NaviData(gene_module_average, list(data.genes), samples))
00381

00388     # Export data and annotations
00389     def _exportData(self, method, processing="raw", name=""):
00390         """
00391         Export data to NaviCell, can be processed data
00392 
00393         Args:
00394             method (str) : name of the method to export
00395             processing (str) : "" to export raw data, processing method to export processed data. See 'averageModule' and '_pcaComponent'
00396         """
00397         self._checkBrowser() # TODO Perform processing if necessary
00398         done_export = False
00399 
00400         if (processing in self._processings):
00401             if (method in self._data[processing]):
00402                 if(method.lower() in METHODS_TYPE):
00403                     if (not self._exported_data[processing][method]):
00404                         name = self._nameData(method, processing, name)
00405                         print("Exporting " + name + " to NaviCell...")
00406                         # Processing change the type of data, like discrete data into continuous, or anything to color data
00407                         biotype = getBiotype(method, processing)
00408                         self._nv.importDatatables(self._data[processing][method]._makeData(self._nv.getHugoList()), name, biotype)
00409                         self._configureDisplay(method, processing)
00410                         self._exported_data[processing][method] = True
00411                         done_export = True
00412                 elif (method in self._data['distribution']):
00413                     pass # Avoid bug
00414                 else:
00415                     raise ValueError("Biotype of '" + method + "' is unknown")
00416             elif (method == "uniform"): # Uniform data for glyphs
00417                 if (not self._exported_data["uniform"]):
00418                     self._nv.importDatatables(self._data["uniform"]._makeData(self._nv.getHugoList()), "uniform", "Discrete Copy number data") # Continuous is better for grouping but posses problems with glyphs
00419                     name = "uniform"
00420                     print("Exporting " + name + " to NaviCell...")
00421                     done_export = True
00422                     self._exported_data["uniform"] = True
00423             elif (method in self._data["distribution"]):
00424                 pass # Exported on creation, to change for multiple NaviCell
00425             else:
00426                 raise KeyError("Method '" + method + "' with processing '" + processing + "' does not exist")
00427         else:
00428             raise KeyError("Processing '" + processing + "' does not exist")
00429 
00430         # Uniform data have been defined when other datas have, but do not recquire explicit export
00431         if (not self._exported_data["uniform"]):
00432             self._exportData("uniform")
00433 
00434     def _checkBrowser(self):
00435         """
00436         Check if the browser is opened or open it
00437         """
00438         if (not self._browser_opened):
00439             print("Launching browser...")
00440             self._nv.launchBrowser()
00441             self._browser_opened = True
00442         return(self._browser_opened)
00443 
00444     def exportAnnotations(self):
00445         """
00446         Export samples annotations to NaviCell
00447         """
00448         self._checkBrowser()
00449 
00450         if (not self._exported_annotations):
00451             self._nv.sampleAnnotationImport(self.annotations._makeData())
00452             self._exported_annotations = True

00454     def _configureDisplay(self, method, processing="raw"):
00455         """
00456         Changes the Color and Size Configuration for the datatable to the one precised by the user.
00457         """
00458         if (getBiotype(method, processing) in CONTINOUS_BIOTYPES):
00459             ## Color configuration
00460             dname = self.getDataName((method, processing))
00461             print("Configuring display for " + dname)
00462             step_count = self._display_config.step_count
00463             for tab in [NaviCell.TABNAME_SAMPLES, NaviCell.TABNAME_GROUPS]:
00464                 self._nv.datatableConfigSetStepCount('', dname, NaviCell.CONFIG_COLOR, tab, step_count-1) # NaviCell has one default step
00465 
00466             dtable = self._data[processing][method].data
00467             maxval = np.nanmax(dtable)
00468             minval = np.nanmin(dtable)
00469             # Use the same scales for positive and negative values, choose the smallest to enhance contrast
00470             if (minval * maxval < 0):
00471                 if (-minval > maxval):
00472                     minval = -maxval
00473                 elif (maxval > -minval):
00474                     maxval = -minval
00475             ftable = dtable.flatten()
00476             ftable.sort()
00477 
00478             if (len(ftable[np.isnan(ftable)]) > 0):
00479                 navicell_offset = 1 # First value is nan
00480                 for tab in [NaviCell.TABNAME_SAMPLES, NaviCell.TABNAME_GROUPS]:
00481                     self._nv.datatableConfigSetColorAt('', dname, NaviCell.CONFIG_COLOR, tab, 0, self._display_config.na_color)
00482             else:
00483                 navicell_offset = 0
00484 
00485             if (self._display_config._zero_color != ""):
00486                 half_count = step_count//2
00487                 if (half_count != 1):
00488                     # Negative values
00489                     if (minval > 0): maxval = -1
00490                     step = -minval/half_count
00491                     values_list = [signif(val) for val in np.arange(minval, step/2, step)][:-1]
00492                     for ii in range(half_count):
00493                        value = values_list[ii]
00494                        color = self._display_config._colors[ii]
00495                        for tab in [NaviCell.TABNAME_SAMPLES, NaviCell.TABNAME_GROUPS]:
00496                            self._nv.datatableConfigSetValueAt('', dname, NaviCell.CONFIG_COLOR, tab, navicell_offset + ii, value)
00497                            self._nv.datatableConfigSetColorAt('', dname, NaviCell.CONFIG_COLOR, tab, navicell_offset + ii, color)
00498                     # Zero if present
00499                     offset = half_count
00500                     if (step_count%2 == 1):
00501                         for tab in [NaviCell.TABNAME_SAMPLES, NaviCell.TABNAME_GROUPS]:
00502                             self._nv.datatableConfigSetValueAt('', dname, NaviCell.CONFIG_COLOR, tab, offset + navicell_offset, 0)
00503                             self._nv.datatableConfigSetColorAt('', dname, NaviCell.CONFIG_COLOR, tab, offset + navicell_offset, self._display_config._colors[half_count])
00504                         offset += 1
00505                     # Positive values
00506                     if (maxval < 0): maxval = 1
00507                     step = maxval/half_count
00508                     values_list = [signif(val) for val in np.arange(0., maxval+step/2, step)][1:]
00509                     for ii in range(half_count):
00510                         value = values_list[ii]
00511                         color = self._display_config._colors[offset + ii]
00512                         for tab in [NaviCell.TABNAME_SAMPLES, NaviCell.TABNAME_GROUPS]:
00513                             self._nv.datatableConfigSetValueAt('', dname, NaviCell.CONFIG_COLOR, tab, navicell_offset + offset + ii, value)
00514                             self._nv.datatableConfigSetColorAt('', dname, NaviCell.CONFIG_COLOR, tab, navicell_offset + offset + ii, color)
00515                 else:
00516                     if (step_count == 2):
00517                         values_list = [minval, maxval]
00518                     else:
00519                         values_list = [minval, 0, maxval]
00520                     for tab in [NaviCell.TABNAME_SAMPLES, NaviCell.TABNAME_GROUPS]:
00521                         for ii in range(len(values_list)):
00522                             self._nv.datatableConfigSetValueAt('', dname, NaviCell.CONFIG_COLOR, tab, navicell_offset + ii, values_list[ii])
00523                             self._nv.datatableConfigSetColorAt('', dname, NaviCell.CONFIG_COLOR, tab, navicell_offset + ii, self._display_config._colors[ii])
00524             else:
00525                 for ii in range(step_count):
00526                     value = np.percentile(dtable, ii*100/(step_count-1))
00527                     if (ii==0): value = minval
00528                     elif (ii==(step_count-1)): value = maxval
00529                     color = self._display_config._colors[ii]
00530                     for tab in [NaviCell.TABNAME_SAMPLES, NaviCell.TABNAME_GROUPS]:
00531                         self._nv.datatableConfigSetValueAt('', dname, NaviCell.CONFIG_COLOR, tab, navicell_offset + ii, value)
00532                         self._nv.datatableConfigSetColorAt('', dname, NaviCell.CONFIG_COLOR, tab, navicell_offset + ii, color)
00533 
00534             self._nv.datatableConfigSetSampleMethod('', dname, NaviCell.CONFIG_COLOR, NaviCell.METHOD_CONTINUOUS_MEDIAN) # TODO change to MEAN when group mean is corrected to <= instead of <
00535             if self._display_config.use_absolute_values:
00536                 self._nv.datatableConfigSetSampleAbsoluteValue("", dname, NaviCell.CONFIG_COLOR, True)
00537             else:
00538                 self._nv.datatableConfigSetSampleAbsoluteValue("", dname, NaviCell.CONFIG_COLOR, False)
00539 
00540             ## Size configuration TODO add zero if present
00541             for glyph_id in range(1, MAX_GLYPHS):
00542                 for tab in [NaviCell.TABNAME_SAMPLES, NaviCell.TABNAME_GROUPS]:
00543                     self._nv.datatableConfigSetSizeAt("", dname, NaviCell.CONFIG_SIZE, tab, 0, self._display_config.na_size)
00544 
00545             self._nv.datatableConfigApply('', dname, NaviCell.CONFIG_COLOR)
00546         
00547     # Display data
00548     def display(self, perform_list, default_samples="all: 1.0", colors="", module='', reset=True):
00549         """
00550         Display data on the NaviCell map
00551         Args :
00552             perform_list (list of 2-tuples): each tuple must contain the name of the data to display and the mode of display ("glyphN_(color|size|shape)", "barplot", "heatmap" or "map_staining"). Barplots and heatmaps cannot be displayed simultaneously. Several data types can be specified for heatmaps. Specifying "glyph" (without number) will automatically select a new glyph for each data using the same properties (shape, color or size) in glyphs (maximum of 5 glyphs).
00553             colors : range of colors to use (NOT IMPLEMENTED YET)
00554             default_samples (str or list of str) : Samples to use. Only the first sample is used for glyphs and map staining, all default_samples from the list are used for heatmaps and barplots. Use 'all_samples' to use all default_samples or ['annot1:...:annotn', 'all_groups'] to use all groups corresponding to the combinations of annot1...annotn.
00555         """
00556         # Correct if the user give a single tuple
00557         if (isinstance(perform_list, tuple)):
00558             perform_list = [perform_list]
00559         assert isinstance(perform_list, list), "perform list must be a list"
00560         assert isinstance(perform_list[0], tuple) and (len(perform_list[0]) == 2 or len(perform_list[0]) == 3), "perform list must be a list of (2/3)-tuples"
00561         self._checkBrowser()
00562         self.exportAnnotations()
00563         if (reset):
00564             self.resetDisplay()
00565 
00566         # Preprocess the perform list to get valid data_name, and export data that have not been exported yet
00567         if (DEBUG_NAVICOM):
00568             print(perform_list)
00569         for perf_id in range(len(perform_list)):
00570             data_name = perform_list[perf_id][0]
00571             perform = perform_list[perf_id]
00572             if (isinstance(data_name, str)):
00573                 if (not data_name in self._associated_data):
00574                     data_name = data_name + "_raw"
00575                 data_name = self._associated_data[data_name]
00576             processing = data_name[0]
00577             method = data_name[1]
00578             assert processing in self._processings, "Processing " + processing + " does not exist"
00579             self._exportData(method, processing)
00580             if (len(perform) >= 3 and perform[2] != default_samples):
00581                 perform_list[perf_id] = (self._data_names[processing][method], perform[1], perform[2])
00582             else:
00583                 perform_list[perf_id] = (self._data_names[processing][method], perform[1], '')
00584         self._exportData("uniform")
00585 
00586         # Control that the user does not try to display to many data or use several times the same display
00587         if (True):
00588             for gtype in GLYPH_TYPES:
00589                 glyph = {gtype:[False] * MAX_GLYPHS}
00590             sample_for_glyph = [False] * MAX_GLYPHS
00591             glyph_samples = [""] * MAX_GLYPHS
00592             glyph_set = False
00593             heatmap = False
00594             barplot = False
00595             barplot_data = ""
00596             map_staining = False
00597             default_samples = self._processSampleSelection(default_samples)
00598             samples = default_samples
00599             lastWasDefault = True
00600             valid_default = (len(default_samples) == 1 and default_samples != "all_groups" and default_samples != "all_samples")
00601         # Perform the display depending of the selected mode
00602         for perform in perform_list:
00603             all_samples = False
00604             all_groups = False
00605             data_name = perform[0]
00606             dmode = perform[1]
00607             dmode = dmode.lower()
00608             # Check groups in NaviCell and get a valid list of samples, reload default if not the last used
00609             if (perform[2] == ''):
00610                 if (not lastWasDefault):
00611                     samples = self._processSampleSelection(default_samples)
00612                     lastWasDefault = True
00613             else:
00614                 samples = self._processSampleSelection(perform[2])
00615                 lastWasDefault = False
00616             if (samples == "all_groups"):
00617                 all_groups = True
00618             elif (samples == "all_samples"):
00619                 all_samples = True
00620 
00621             if (re.search("^(glyph|color|size|shape)", dmode)):
00622                 glyph_set = True
00623                 # Extract the glyph id and the setup
00624                 parse_setup = dmode.split("_")
00625                 glyph_setup = parse_setup
00626                 if (len(parse_setup) == 2):
00627                     try:
00628                         glyph_setup = [parse_setup[1] + str(int(parse_setup[0][-1]))]
00629                     except ValueError:
00630                         glyph_setup = [parse_setup[1]]
00631                 elif (len(parse_setup) != 1):
00632                     raise ValueError("Glyph specification '" + dmode + "' incorrect")
00633                 try:
00634                     glyph_number = int(glyph_setup[0][-1])
00635                     glyph_type = glyph_setup[0][:-1]
00636                 except ValueError:
00637                     glyph_type = glyph_setup[0]
00638                     glyph_number = 1
00639                     while (glyph[glyph_type][glyph_number-1]):
00640                         glyph_number += 1
00641                 glyph_id = glyph_number - 1
00642                 
00643                 if (not glyph_number in range(1, MAX_GLYPHS+1)):
00644                     raise ValueError("Glyph number must be in [1," + str(MAX_GLYPHS) + "]")
00645                 if (not glyph_type in GLYPH_TYPES):
00646                     raise ValueError("Glyph type must be one of " + str(GLYPH_TYPES))
00647                 if (glyph[glyph_type][glyph_number-1]):
00648                     raise ValueError(glyph_type + " for glyph " + str(glyph_number) + " has already been specified")
00649                 glyph[glyph_type][glyph_number-1] = True
00650                 if (len(samples) != 1 or samples == "all_groups" or samples == "all_samples"):
00651                     raise ValueError("Only one group or sample can be used for glyphs")
00652 
00653                 if (lastWasDefault):
00654                     pass
00655                 elif (glyph_samples[glyph_id] == ""):
00656                     glyph_samples[glyph_id] = samples[0]
00657                     sample_for_glyph[glyph_id] = True
00658                 elif (glyph_samples[glyph_id] != samples[0]):
00659                     raise ValueError("Only one sample can be specified per glyph")
00660 
00661                 cmd="self._nv.glyphEditorSelect" + glyph_type.capitalize() + "Datatable('" + module +  "', " + str(glyph_number) + ", '" + data_name + "')"
00662                 if (DEBUG_NAVICOM):
00663                     print(cmd)
00664                 exec(cmd)
00665             elif (re.search("map_?staining", dmode)):
00666                 assert valid_default, "Only one sample can be used for map staining"
00667                 if (not map_staining):
00668                     self._nv.mapStainingEditorSelectDatatable(module, data_name)
00669                     self._nv.mapStainingEditorSelectSample(module, samples[0])
00670                     self._nv.mapStainingEditorApply(module)
00671                     map_staining = True
00672                 else:
00673                     raise ValueError("Map staining can only be applied once, use a separate call to the display function to change map staining")
00674             elif (re.search("heatmap", dmode)):
00675                 if (barplot):
00676                     raise ValueError("Heatmaps and barplots cannot be applied simultaneously, use a separate call to the display function to perform the heatmap")
00677                 heatmap = True
00678                 # Select data
00679                 self._nv.heatmapEditorSelectDatatable(module, self._hdid, data_name)
00680                 self._hdid += 1
00681                 # Select samples
00682                 if (all_samples):
00683                     self._nv.heatmapEditorAllSamples(module)
00684                 elif (all_groups):
00685                     self._nv.heatmapEditorAllGroups(module)
00686                 elif (self._hsid == 0):
00687                     for spl in samples:
00688                         self._nv.heatmapEditorSelectSample(module, self._hsid, spl)
00689                         self._hsid += 1
00690                     self._nv.heatmapEditorApply(module)
00691             elif (re.search("barplot", dmode)):
00692                 if (heatmap):
00693                     raise ValueError("Heatmaps and barplots cannot be applied simultaneously, use a separate call to the display function to perform the barplot")
00694                 # Check that it does not try to add new data, and simply adds samples # TODO Remove as samples cannot be added (resetDisplay at the beginning)
00695                 if (barplot and data_name != barplot_data and not re.search("all|groups|samples", data_name)):
00696                     raise ValueError("Barplot has already been set with different data, use a separate call to the display function to perform another barplot")
00697                 barplot = True
00698                 barplot_data = data_name
00699                 self._nv.barplotEditorSelectDatatable(module, data_name)
00700                 # Select samples
00701                 if (all_samples):
00702                     self._nv.barplotEditorAllSamples(module)
00703                 elif (all_groups):
00704                     self._nv.barplotEditorAllGroups(module)
00705                 elif (self._bid == 0):
00706                     for spl in samples:
00707                         self._nv.barplotEditorSelectSample(module, self._bid, spl)
00708                         self._bid += 1
00709                     self._nv.barplotEditorApply(module)
00710             else:
00711                 raise ValueError("'" + dmode + "' drawing mode does not exist")
00712 
00713         # Check that datatables are selected for all glyphs features (until default has been added)
00714         # or complete, then apply the glyphs configuration
00715         default_samples = self._processSampleSelection(default_samples)
00716         if (glyph_set):
00717             for glyph_id in range(MAX_GLYPHS):
00718                 nsets = sum(1 for cs in GLYPH_TYPES if glyph[cs][glyph_id])
00719                 if (nsets > 0):
00720                     if (sample_for_glyph[glyph_id]):
00721                         self._nv.glyphEditorSelectSample(module, glyph_id+1, self._processSampleSelection(glyph_samples[glyph_id]))
00722                     elif (valid_default):
00723                         print("Using default sample for glyph " + str(glyph_id+1))
00724                         self._nv.glyphEditorSelectSample(module, glyph_id+1, default_samples[0])
00725                     else:
00726                         raise ValueError("No samples specified for glyph " + str(glyph_id+1) + " and default_samples is invalid")
00727                     if (not glyph["color"][glyph_id]):
00728                         self._nv.glyphEditorSelectColorDatatable(module, glyph_id+1, "uniform")
00729                     if (not glyph["shape"][glyph_id]):
00730                        self._nv.glyphEditorSelectShapeDatatable(module, glyph_id+1, "uniform")
00731                     if (not glyph["size"][glyph_id]):
00732                         self._nv.glyphEditorSelectSizeDatatable(module, glyph_id+1, "uniform")
00733                     self._nv.glyphEditorApply(module, glyph_id+1)
00734 
00735     def resetDisplay(self):
00736         """
00737         Reset the data and samples selections in NaviCell
00738         """
00739         for ii in range(self._bid):
00740             self._nv.barplotEditorSelectSample('', ii, '')
00741         self._nv.barplotEditorSelectDatatable('', '')
00742         self._nv.drawingConfigSelectBarplot('', False)
00743 
00744         for ii in range(self._hsid):
00745             self._nv.heatmapEditorSelectSample('', ii, '')
00746         for ii in range(self._hdid):
00747             self._nv.heatmapEditorSelectDatatable('', ii, '')
00748         self._nv.drawingConfigSelectHeatmap('', False)
00749 
00750         for gid in range(1, MAX_GLYPHS):
00751             for gt in GLYPH_TYPES:
00752                 exec("self._nv.glyphEditorSelect" + gt.capitalize() + "Datatable('', " + str(gid) + ", '')")
00753             self._nv.glyphEditorSelectSample('', gid, '')
00754             self._nv.drawingConfigSelectGlyph('', gid, False)
00755         
00756         self._nv.drawingConfigSelectMapStaining('', False)
00757         self._nv.drawingConfigApply('')
00758 
00759         # Reset the counters
00760         self._bid = 0
00761         self._hsid = 0
00762         self._hdid = 0
00763 
00764     def _resetAnnotationsSelection(self, module=''):
00765         for annot in self.annotations.annotations:
00766             self._nv.sampleAnnotationSelectAnnotation(module, annot, False)
00767         self._nv.sampleAnnotationApply(module)
00768 
00769     def _selectAnnotations(self, annotations, module=''):
00770         """
00771         Select annotations on the NaviCell map
00772         """
00773         if (isinstance(annotations, str)):
00774             self._nv.sampleAnnotationSelectAnnotation(module, annotations, True)
00775         elif (isinstance(annotations, list)):
00776             for annot in annotations:
00777                 self._nv.sampleAnnotationSelectAnnotation(module, annot, True)
00778         else:
00779             raise ValueError("'annotations' must be a string or a list")
00780         self._nv.sampleAnnotationApply(module)
00781 
00782     def _processSampleSelection(self, current_samples):
00783         """
00784         Process a list of samples or groups to a list of samples/groups names exportable to NaviCell or to "all_groups"/"all_samples" for heatmap and barplot, and select the correct groups in NaviCell
00785         """
00786 
00787         self._resetAnnotationsSelection()
00788         # Make sure current_samples is a list
00789         all_groups = False
00790         if (isinstance(current_samples, str)):
00791             current_samples = [current_samples]
00792 
00793         # It is possible to select all samples or all groups on heatmap and barplot
00794         if (current_samples[0] == "all_samples" or current_samples[0] == "samples"):
00795             return "all_samples"
00796         elif (current_samples[0] == "all" or current_samples[0] == "all: 1.0"):
00797             self._selectAnnotations("all")
00798             return ["all: 1.0"]
00799         elif (len(current_samples) > 1 and (current_samples[1] == "all_groups" or current_samples[1] == "groups")):
00800             all_groups = True
00801 
00802         refGroupsList = []
00803         first_groups = True
00804         # Select the groups that must be selected to produce the composite groups required
00805         for sample in current_samples:
00806             groups = self._processGroupsName(sample)[0]
00807             # Check that all groups are compatible in the annotations selected (because lower order composition are not generated). No check for individual samples
00808             if (len(groups) >= 1):
00809                 if (first_groups): # Select the set of annotations for the first group
00810                     if (DEBUG_NAVICOM):
00811                         print("Selecting " + str(groups))
00812                     for group in groups:
00813                         self._selectAnnotations(group) 
00814                         refGroupsList.append(group)
00815                         first_groups = False
00816                 else: # Control that all other groups are compatible
00817                         assert len(group)==0 or len(refGroupsList)==0 or len(group)==len(refGroupsList), "Groups combinations are not compatible, different number of groups"
00818                         for group in groups:
00819                             assert group in refGroupsList, "Groups combinations are not compatibles as " + group + " is not in " + str(refGroupsList)
00820 
00821         if (all_groups):
00822             return "all_groups"
00823         return current_samples
00824 
00825     def _processGroupsName(self, groupName):
00826         """
00827         Process a group selection string and return the names of the individual groups to select and the corresponding values selected.
00828         """
00829         selections = groupName.split(";")
00830         groups = list()
00831         values = list()
00832         for select in selections:
00833             subName = select.split(":")
00834             group = subName[0].strip()
00835             if (group in self.annotations.annotations):
00836                 value = subName[1].strip()
00837                 groups.append(group)
00838                 try:
00839                     values.append(float(value))
00840                 except ValueError:
00841                     values.append(value)
00842             elif (not (group in self.annotations.samples or re.match("sub", group) or group == "NaN")):
00843                 if (len(subName) > 1):
00844                     raise ValueError("Annotation " + group + " does not exist")
00845                 else:
00846                     raise ValueError("Sample " + group + " does not exist")
00847         return((groups, values))
00848 
00849     def displayMethylome(self, samples="all: 1.0", processing="raw", background="mRNA", methylation="glyph"):
00850         """
00851             Display the methylation data as glyphs or heatmap on the NaviCell map, with mRNA expression of gene CNV as map staining
00852             Args:
00853                 background (str) : should genes, mRNA or no data be used for the map staining
00854                 processing (str) : should the processed data be used
00855         """
00856         # Groups cannot be used for now because of limitations in NaviCell unless the median is taken as grouping operation
00857         mrna_alias = ["MRNA"] # TODO Define what to put here
00858         gene_alias = ["CNV", "CNA", "CCNA", "CCNV", "DNA"]
00859         background = background.upper()
00860         assert background in mrna_alias + gene_alias + ["NO", ""], "Select either genes, mRNA or no data for the map staining"
00861         assert methylation in ["glyph", "glyphs", "heatmap", "size", "glyph_size"], "Cannot use " + methylation + " to display methylation data"
00862         if (methylation != "heatmap"): methylation="size"
00863         assert processing in self._data, "Processing " + processing + " does not exist"
00864 
00865         # Select all methylation data and display as heatmap
00866         disp_selection = list()
00867         for method in self._data[processing]:
00868             included = method.lower() in METHODS_TYPE
00869             if (re.search("methylation", method.lower()) or (included and METHODS_TYPE[method.lower()] == "methylation")):
00870                 disp_selection.append((self._data_names[processing][method], methylation)) # TODO Change to barplot when several datatables can be used
00871         # Display mRNA or gene data as map staining
00872         if (background in mrna_alias):
00873             for mrna in TYPES_SPEC["mRNA"][0]:
00874                 if (mrna in self._data[processing]):
00875                     disp_selection.append((self._data_names[processing][mrna], "map_staining"))
00876                     break
00877         elif (background in gene_alias):
00878             for gene in TYPES_SPEC["cCNA"]+TYPES_SPEC["dCNA"]:
00879                 if (gene in self._data[processing]):
00880                     disp_selection.append((self._data_names[processing][mrna], "map_staining"))
00881                     break
00882         if (DEBUG_NAVICOM):
00883             print(disp_selection)
00884             print(samples)
00885         self.display(disp_selection, samples)
00886 
00887     def displayTranscriptome(self, dataName, group="all: 1.0", samplesDisplay="", samples=list(), binsNb=10):
00888         """
00889         Display one transcriptome data as map staining, with optionnaly some extra displays (samples as heatmap or barplot, mutations as glyphs, a glyph for the most highly expressed genes)
00890         Args:
00891             dataName (str or tuple): name or identifier of the data.
00892             group (str): Identifier of the group to display
00893             samplesDisplay (str): Channel where the individual samples should be displayed (heatmap or barplot)
00894             samples (list or str): list of samples to display, or a string specifying how such a list should be built ('quantiles' to get the distribution of values)
00895             nbOfSamples (int): number of individual samples to display, ignored if samples is a list
00896         """
00897         allowedDisplays = ["", "heatmap", "barplot"]
00898         assert samplesDisplay in allowedDisplays, "samplesDisplay must one of " + str(allowedDisplays)
00899         dataName = self.getDataName(dataName)
00900         self.display([(dataName, "map_staining")], group)
00901         if (samplesDisplay != ""):
00902             if (isinstance(samples, list)):
00903                 self.display([(dataName, samplesDisplay)], samples, reset=False)
00904             elif (isinstance(samples, str)):
00905                 if (samples == "quantiles"):
00906                     distName, distSamples = self._generateDistributionData(dataName, group, binsNb)
00907                     self._data["distribution"][distName].exportToNaviCell(self._nv, TYPES_BIOTYPE['mRNA'], distName)
00908                     self.display([(distName, samplesDisplay)], distSamples, reset=False)
00909                 else:
00910                     self.display([(dataName, samplesDisplay)], [samples], reset=False)
00911 
00912     def _generateDistributionData(self, dataName, group, binsNb=10):
00913         """
00914         Compute distribution of values for all genes for one type of data. Use the same scale for all genes. The distribution is centered on 0 if it is included, so that it is easy to see if a gene is over- or under-expressed.
00915         """
00916         groups, values = self._processGroupsName(group)
00917         if (len(groups) < 1):
00918             raise ValueError("Cannot generate a distribution without a valid group")
00919         # Each distribution 
00920         distName = "distribution_" + dataName + "_" + re.sub(" ", "_", group) + "_" + str(binsNb)
00921         distSamples = ["sub" + str(ii) for ii in range(binsNb)] + ["NaN"]
00922         if (distName in self._data["distribution"]):
00923             return(distName)
00924 
00925         # Identify the samples selected by the group definition
00926         samples = self.annotations.samplesPerCategory[groups[0]][values[0]]
00927         for idx in range(1, len(groups)):
00928             to_drop = list()
00929             for spl in samples:
00930                 if (not spl in self.annotations.samplesPerCategory[groups[idx]][values[idx]]):
00931                     to_drop.append(spl)
00932             for spl in to_drop:
00933                 samples.remove(spl)
00934 
00935         # Build the distribution dataset
00936         data = self.getData(dataName)[samples]
00937         minq = np.nanmin(data.data)
00938         maxq = np.nanmax(data.data)
00939         step = (maxq-minq)/binsNb
00940         if (minq * maxq < 0):
00941             step = max(-minq/(binsNb/2), maxq/(binsNb/2))
00942         qseq = np.arange(minq, maxq + step * 1.01, step)
00943         newData = list()
00944         for gene in data.genes:
00945             newData.append([0 for ii in range(binsNb+1)])
00946             for value in data[gene]:
00947                 if (np.isnan(value)):
00948                     newData[-1][binsNb] += 1
00949                 else:
00950                     idx = 0
00951                     while (value > qseq[idx+1]):
00952                         idx += 1
00953                     newData[-1][idx] += 1
00954         self._data["distribution"][distName] = NaviData(newData, data.genes, distSamples)
00955         # Fill the dictionnaries to avoid display bugs
00956         self._data_names['distribution'][distName] = distName
00957         self._associated_data[distName] = ('distribution', distName)
00958 
00959         return(distName, distSamples)
00960 
00961     def _colorsOverlay(self, red="uniform", green="uniform", blue="uniform", processing=""):
00962         """
00963         Create a dataset where values are colors. The color is calculated according to three datasets.
00964 
00965         Args:
00966             red : data name or tuple (processing, method)
00967             green : data name or tuple (processing, method)
00968             blue : data name or tuple (processing, method)
00969         """
00970         assert red != "uniform" or green != "uniform" or blue != "uniform", "You must choose a datatable"
00971         # TODO export to NaviCell and display
00972         colors = [red, green, blue]
00973         mset = ""
00974         # Empty string table
00975         dims = self._data["uniform"].data.shape
00976         dataset = np.zeros(dims, '<U7')
00977         for rr in range(dims[0]):
00978             for cc in range(dims[1]):
00979                 dataset[rr,cc] = "#"
00980         for col in colors:
00981             if (col == "uniform"):
00982                 for rr in range(dims[0]):
00983                     for cc in range(dims[1]):
00984                         dataset[rr,cc] += "00" # Default to black
00985             else:
00986                 # Pick the datatable
00987                 if (processing == ""):
00988                     processing, method = getDataTuple(col)
00989                 elif (not processing in self._data):
00990                     raise ValueError("Processing " + processing + " does not exist")
00991                 elif (not col in self._data[processing]):
00992                     raise ValueError("Method \"" + col + "\" does not exist with processing \"" + processing + "\"")
00993                 else:
00994                     method = col
00995                 if (processing != "raw"):
00996                     mset += processing + "_"
00997                 mset += method + "_"
00998                 # Input the value in the new dataset
00999                 minval = np.nanmin(self._data[processing][method].data)
01000                 maxval = np.nanmax(self._data[processing][method].data)
01001                 if (np.isnan(minval) or np.isnan(maxval)):
01002                     warn("Datatable (" + processing + ", " + method + ") does not contain any value.")
01003                     for rr in range(dims[0]):
01004                         for cc in range(dims[1]):
01005                             dataset[rr,cc] = "00"
01006                 else:
01007                     for rr in range(dims[0]):
01008                         for cc in range(dims[1]):
01009                             value = self._data[processing][method].data[rr,cc]
01010                             if (np.isnan(value)):
01011                                 value = minval
01012                             intensity = re.sub("0x", "", hex(int( 16 * (value - minval) / (maxval-minval) )) )
01013                             if (len(intensity) == 0):
01014                                 intensity = "0" + intensity
01015                             dataset[rr,cc] += intensity
01016         mset = re.sub("_$", "", mset)
01017         self._data["colors"][mset] = NaviData(dataset, self._data[processing][method].rows, self._data[processing][method].columns, processing="colors", method="unknown")
01018 
01019     # Saving data
01020     def saveAllData(self, folder=""):
01021         """
01022         Save all data in an .ncc file. Does not save the distribution nor color data.
01023         """
01024         if (folder != ""):
01025             folder = re.sub("/?$", "/", folder)
01026         fname = folder + self.name + ".ncc"
01027         print("Saving as " + fname)
01028         ff = open(fname, "w")
01029         ff.close()
01030         allProcessings = list(self._data)
01031         allProcessings.remove("uniform")
01032         allProcessings.remove("distribution")
01033         allProcessings.remove("color")
01034         for processing in allProcessings:
01035             for method in self._data[processing]:
01036                 print("Saving " + processing + ", " + method)# + ", " + str(self._data[processing][method]))
01037                 self._data[processing][method].saveData(fname, "a")
01038         print("Saving Annotations")
01039         self.annotations.saveData(fname, "a")
01040 
01041     def saveData(self, method, processing="raw", folder="./"):
01042         """
01043         Save the data in a file that can be exported to NaviCell or imported in NaviCom
01044         """
01045         # TODO authorize to provide a list to save a custom dataset
01046         if (folder != ""):
01047             folder = re.sub("/?$", "/", folder)
01048         if (processing in self._data):
01049             if (method in self._data[processing]):
01050                 self._data[processing][method].saveData(baseName=folder+self.name)
01051             else:
01052                 raise ValueError("Method " + method + " does not exist with processing " + processing)
01053         else:
01054             raise ValueError("Processing " + processing + " does not exist")
01055
